normalised: ## Automotive: E V Charging Woes and Wins!

unnormalised: Guys, the EV scene is heating up faster than Mumbai in May! But let's be real, finding a reliable charging point can still feel like navigating a Bhaijaan movie plot - full of twists and unexpected roadblocks.
normalised: Guys, the E V scene is heating up faster than Mumbai in May! But let's be real, finding a reliable charging point can still feel like navigating a Bhaijaan movie plot - full of twists and unexpected roadblocks.

unnormalised: Remember that road trip to Lonavala you planned? Yeah, factor in an extra couple of hours hunting for a charger that *actually* works. The good news? IIT Bombay is apparently working on some next-gen charging tech that promises faster charging times and better grid integration. Fingers crossed!
normalised: Remember that road trip to Lonavala you planned? Yeah, factor in an extra couple of hours hunting for a charger that *actually* works. The good news? I I T Bombay is apparently working on some next-gen charging tech that promises faster charging times and better grid integration. Fingers crossed!

unnormalised: Meanwhile, Tata Power is aggressively expanding its charging network across highways and cities. You might even spot one near your favourite chai stall!
normalised: Meanwhile, Tata Power is aggressively expanding its charging network across highways and cities. You might even spot one near your favourite chai stall!

unnormalised: Speaking of chai, expect to pay anything from Rs. 15 to Rs. 25 per unit, depending on the charger and location. And range anxiety? Still a thing, especially if you’re planning a trip beyond 300 km. But hey, at least you’re saving the planet, right? Now, if only someone could invent a self-charging auto-rickshaw!
normalised: Speaking of chai, expect to pay anything from rupees fifteen to rupees twenty five per unit, depending on the charger and location. And range anxiety? Still a thing, especially if you’re planning a trip beyond three hundred kilometer. But hey, at least you’re saving the planet, right? Now, if only someone could invent a self-charging auto-rickshaw!
